thig13.2:4.3: 'kittayati' means 'to honor, glorify, praise'. So she is saying "For you, I will speak in praise of their wisdom, morality, and commitment."
thig13.2:5.4: perhaps "it is because of this that contemplatives are dear to me." or simply "because of this, contemplatives are dear to me."
thig13.2:11.2: 'manta' can mean either 'mantra' or 'advice/counseling'. So this might be "giving advice, unconceited" or "giving counsel without conceit" or some such.
thig13.2:12.2: "they never look back" (there is no word in this phrase that means 'worldly attachment' or 'longing' - that is 'anapekkha' in the next phrase, which is already translated separately.)
